html: The coming of the “Day of Jehovah”—Jehovah’s Day of Judgment—parallels the coming of the Assyrian alliance to wreak havoc throughout the earth. Jehovah’s wrath, like his anger (v 3), designates the archtyrant, who exemplifies these traits (Isaiah 10:5). His destruction of all nations, including the wicked of Jehovah’s people, is a consistent theme in the Book of Isaiah (Isaiah 5:25-30; 10:23; 14:23; 28:22; 33:1; 37:18; 51:13; 54:16; 59:18-19; 63:3-6). Although he launches his attack “from a distant land beyond the horizon,” it comes as a “violent blow” from Jehovah himself (Isaiah 30:27; 42:13-15).
